body_html:
The test failures seems to be persistent and so I believe it's related to some c2 core changes made in this PR.

02:53:04 Trying example: test_atomic_iter_with_concurrent_steps(self=<caffe2.python.hypothesis_test.TestOperators testMethod=test_atomic_iter_with_concurrent_steps>, initial_iters=0, num_iters=67, num_nets=3)
02:53:04 Traceback (most recent call last):
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/hypothesis/core.py", line 669, in evaluate_test_data
02:53:04     result = self.execute(data, collect=True)
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/hypothesis/core.py", line 584, in execute
02:53:04     result = self.test_runner(data, run)
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/hypothesis/executors.py", line 58, in default_new_style_executor
02:53:04     return function(data)
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/hypothesis/core.py", line 580, in run
02:53:04     return test(*args, **kwargs)
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/caffe2/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/caffe2/python/hypothesis_test.py", line 1684, in test_atomic_iter_with_concurrent_steps
02:53:04     num_iters=st.integers(0, 100),
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/hypothesis/core.py", line 524, in test
02:53:04     result = self.test(*args, **kwargs)
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/caffe2/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/caffe2/python/hypothesis_test.py", line 1716, in test_atomic_iter_with_concurrent_steps
02:53:04     self.assertEqual(b'atomic_iter/stats/iter/num_iter', stats_key[0])
02:53:04   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/unittest/case.py", line 513, in assertEqual
02:53:04     assertion_func(first, second, msg=msg)
02:53:04   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/unittest/case.py", line 506, in _baseAssertEqual
02:53:04     raise self.failureException(msg)
02:53:04 AssertionError: 'atomic_iter/stats/iter/num_iter' != 'epoch_timer/time_ns/count'

Unfortunately I can not repro it on several machines (even with same docker images as in our CI). I need some more time to investigate.

body:
The test failures seems to be persistent and so I believe it's related to some c2 core changes made in this PR.

```
02:53:04 Trying example: test_atomic_iter_with_concurrent_steps(self=<caffe2.python.hypothesis_test.TestOperators testMethod=test_atomic_iter_with_concurrent_steps>, initial_iters=0, num_iters=67, num_nets=3)
02:53:04 Traceback (most recent call last):
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/hypothesis/core.py", line 669, in evaluate_test_data
02:53:04     result = self.execute(data, collect=True)
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/hypothesis/core.py", line 584, in execute
02:53:04     result = self.test_runner(data, run)
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/hypothesis/executors.py", line 58, in default_new_style_executor
02:53:04     return function(data)
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/hypothesis/core.py", line 580, in run
02:53:04     return test(*args, **kwargs)
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/caffe2/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/caffe2/python/hypothesis_test.py", line 1684, in test_atomic_iter_with_concurrent_steps
02:53:04     num_iters=st.integers(0, 100),
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/hypothesis/core.py", line 524, in test
02:53:04     result = self.test(*args, **kwargs)
02:53:04   File "/usr/local/caffe2/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/caffe2/python/hypothesis_test.py", line 1716, in test_atomic_iter_with_concurrent_steps
02:53:04     self.assertEqual(b'atomic_iter/stats/iter/num_iter', stats_key[0])
02:53:04   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/unittest/case.py", line 513, in assertEqual
02:53:04     assertion_func(first, second, msg=msg)
02:53:04   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/unittest/case.py", line 506, in _baseAssertEqual
02:53:04     raise self.failureException(msg)
02:53:04 AssertionError: 'atomic_iter/stats/iter/num_iter' != 'epoch_timer/time_ns/count'
```

Unfortunately I can not repro it on several machines (even with same docker images as in our CI). I need some more time to investigate.
